full_title_en: Wexner Score for Obstructed Defecation Syndrome (ODS)

seo.meta_description_en: The Wexner Score for Obstructed Defecation Syndrome (ODS) stratifies severity of fecal incontinence in patients.
seo.keywords_en: Wexner score, fecal incontinence, Obstructed Defecation Syndrome, ODS

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en:
• Does not account for fecal urgency.

  • Easily understood by patients.

next_steps.advice_en: A focused history should be taken for patients with any degree of incontinence.

about.more_info_en:
Interpretation:

Scores range from 0-20, with 0 indicating perfect continence and 20 indicating complete incontinence.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Jorge JM, Wexner SD. Etiology and management of fecal incontinence. Dis Colon Rectum. 1993;36(1):77-97.

Validation.text: Vaizey CJ, Carapeti E, Cahill JA, Kamm MA. Prospective comparison of faecal incontinence grading systems. Gut. 1999;44(1):77-80.

creator_info.about_en: Steven D. Wexner, MD, PhD (Honorary) FACS, FRCS, is the chairman of the department of colorectal surgery and the director of the Digestive Disease Center at Cleveland Clinic Florida. He also led the development of the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer National Accreditation Program for Rectal Cancer (NAPRC). Dr. Wexner’s primary research is focused on laparoscopic and robotic colorectal surgery, surgical oncology, and inflammatory bowel disease.
